title: Elliot Parke
text:
Elliot Anderson Parke (19 July 1850 – 22 June 1923) was an English amateur <a href="cricket">cricket</a>er who played in eight <a href="first-class%20cricket">first-class cricket</a> matches between 1874 and 1884.
Parke was born at <a href="Belgravia">Belgravia</a> in London in 1850 and educated at <a href="Harrow%20School">Harrow School</a> and <a href="Oxford%20University">Oxford University</a>, although he did not play cricket for either his school or for the university. He played mostly for amateur teams such as <a href="Marylebone%20Cricket%20Club">MCC</a>, <a href="Incogniti">Incogniti</a> and Blue Mantles, but made his first-class debut for <a href="Kent%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Kent County Cricket Club</a> in 1874, playing against <a href="Derbyshire%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Derbyshire</a>. Parke's other first-class appearances came between 1879 and 1884, six for MCC and one for the South.
Parke was described in his "<a href="Wisden">Wisden</a>" obituary as being a "good batsman" and a "fast, round-arm bowler". He scored 110 runs and took one wicket in his eight first-class appearances. He died at his house at Cromwell Park, <a href="South%20Kensington">South Kensington</a> in London in 1923 aged 72.
